quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Snow and Brazil
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, best-selling, brazil. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of tourism is well developed in the Brazilian state Rio Grande do Sul?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What fictional character, described as valiant, found herself in a snowy wood at night- time with snow under her feet and snowflakes falling through the air?

options.text: Lucy in The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucy in The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

questions.question: Belo Horizonte is the capital of which state of Brazil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minas Gerais

questions.question: The Brazilian town of Paraty was founded by Portuguese colonizers. What does the name of the town mean in the Tupi language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: river of fish

questions.question: What Victorian novelist idealised white Christmas by persistently depicting snow-carpeted streets and people scraping the snow from the pavements in front of their dwellings, and from the tops of their houses?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Dickens

questions.question: What best-selling novel was written by American writer David Guterson in the early morning hours over a ten-year period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snow Falling on Cedars

questions.question: What poet, honored with four Pulitzer Prizes for Poetry, wrote the 1922 poem Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Frost

questions.question: In what fairy tale does Kays grandmother describe snow flakes as white bees swarming?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Snow Queen

questions.question: This densely populated city is the capital of Ceara, one of the 27 states of Brazil.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fortaleza

questions.question: The Pantanal is a tropical wetland with a number of different ecosystems.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What English poet wrote the poem In the Bleak Midwinter in which Snow had fallen, snow on snow,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christina Rossetti

questions.question: The novel Miss Smillas Sense of Snow tells the story of Smilla Jaspersen who has developed an almost intuitive understanding of all types of snow. What nationality is author Peter Høeg who penned the novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danish

questions.question: Who wrote the novel The Long Winter, which is set in South Dakota during the severe winter of 1880–1881?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laura Ingalls Wilder

questions.question: What city was the first colonial capital of Brazil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salvador da Bahia

questions.question: Olinda is a historic city in which Brazilian state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pernambuco

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Montana and State
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, nickname, bears. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what fantasy novel do armored white bears live in the ice-and-snow-locked land Svalbard?

options.text: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northern Lights (The Golden Compass)

questions.question: What is the state animal of the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grizzly Bear

questions.question: Which of these popular American actors was born in the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patrick Duffy

questions.question: What was the U.S. state of Montana named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the capital city of the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helena

questions.question: In 1888, the capital of the U.S. state of Montana earned this title.

options.text: City with most shoes per capita
City with most millionaires per capita
City with most shovels per capita

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City with most millionaires per capita

questions.question: What is the largest religious group on the island of Bali?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hindus

questions.question: What is the state flower of the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: The official state motto of the U.S. state of Montana is Oro y Plata. What does this mean in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gold and silver

questions.question: The island of Java is part of the territory of which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indonesia

questions.question: What rare findings have been made in the Hell Creek Formation in the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dinosaur fossils

questions.question: What is the name of the provincial capital of the island of Bali?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denpasar

questions.question: What American Modernist poet wrote the poem The Snow Man, which opens with the lines,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wallace Stevens

questions.question: What nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Treasure State

questions.question: What 1994 Academy Award-winning movie was set in the U.S. state of Montana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Legends of the Fall

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Dubai and Bali
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, independence, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital city of Algeria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Algiers

questions.question: What statement is correct regarding “The World” in Dubai?

options.text: It is an archipelago constructed in the shape of a world map.
It is a artificial archipelago of 300 islands.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: When did the Arab Emirates gain independence from the UK?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1971

questions.question: What type of musical instruments does the music of Bali called gamelan mostly require?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Percussion instruments

questions.question: The Hydropolis Underwater Hotel in Dubai is the world’s first underwater hotel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Burj Al Arab is a luxury hotel in Dubai.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is the official language of Algeria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arabic

questions.question: Which crop is most widely cultivated on the island of Bali?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rice

questions.question: Dubai Towers is a four tower complex whose design represents the movement of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: candlelight

questions.question: Islam is the official religion of the United Arab Emirates.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the height of the Burj Dubai skyscraper which comprises 162 floors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 828m

questions.question: Which of the following is located in Dubai?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which European language is the most widely spoken non-native language on the island of Bali?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English

questions.question: The Palm Jumeirah is an artificial archipelago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following statement is true about Dubai?

options.text: There are no natural river bodies or oases.
The climate is hot and arid
It is situated on the Persian Gulf coast.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Colombia and Algeria
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, festival, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the religion of the vast majority of the population of the Republic of Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Catholicism

questions.question: What international pop star was born in Barranquilla, Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shakira

questions.question: What is the official language of Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish

questions.question: What are the colors of the national flag of the Republic of Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow, blue and red

questions.question: Which of these African countries shares a border with Algeria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Niger

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the demographics of the Republic of Colombia according to the 2008 census?

options.text: It is the second most populous country in South America.
It is the third most populous country in Latin America.
It is the fifth most populous country in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the third most populous country in Latin America.

questions.question: What is the official title of the national anthem of the Republic of Colombia?

options.text: National Anthem of the Republic of Colombia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Anthem of the Republic of Colombia

questions.question: The title of the national anthem of Algeria is Kassaman or Qassaman. What does this mean in Arabic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pledge

questions.question: What is the national motto of the Republic of Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liberty and Order

questions.question: What is the largest city in the Republic of Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bogota

questions.question: What vegetable is the main ingredient in the traditional Colombian soup called Ajiaco?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Potato

questions.question: What does the term rai, which is associated with Algerian culture, denote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Musical genre

questions.question: The name of Algeria is derived from which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City

questions.question: In what month is the Festival of the Flowers traditionally held in Medellin, Colombia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August

questions.question: What is the form of government of Algeria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Presidential republic

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Malaysia and Example
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mary, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the name of Malaysia mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hill town

questions.question: In what Spanish city is the Alhambra Palace located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Granada

questions.question: The Torre del Oro is a site located in the Spanish port of Seville. What does the name torre del orro literally mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Tower

questions.question: What type of governmental control has been established in Malaysia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constitutional monarchy

questions.question: What popular Spanish resort city is the birth place of Pablo Picasso?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malaga

questions.question: What site in the Spanish town of San Lorenzo de El Escorial was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monastery

questions.question: What is the official language in Malaysia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malay

questions.question: Paella is an example of typical Valencian food.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Royal Palace of Madrid is decorated by artists such as Velázquez, Caravaggio and Goya.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The national anthem of Malaysia is entitled Negaraku. What does this mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My country

questions.question: What famous explorer was buried at the Seville Cathedral?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Columbus

questions.question: There is an antique wooden figure of Mother Mary and her infant in the Montserrat Monastery, Barcelona, Spain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Hari Merdeka is a national holiday in Malaysia. What does it commemorate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Independence from Britain

questions.question: The Cathedral of Toledo is an example of Gothic architecture.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what century was the world famous Prado museum established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19th

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tokyo and Venezuela
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, theory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year were the Olympic Games held in Tokyo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1964

questions.question: What is the name of the Tokyo professional baseball team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giants

questions.question: What is the official language adopted by the government of Venezuela?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish

questions.question: Which of these is NOT located in Tokyo?

options.text: the headquarters of the Sumo Wrestling Association
the Ginza shopping and entertainment district

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Narita International Airport

questions.question: There is strong competition to be admitted to this prestigious Japanese university, located in Tokyo and established in 1877.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tokyo University

questions.question: If you drew a line directly east from Tokyo, across the Pacific and through the United States you would pass very near this US city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raleigh

questions.question: What was the former name of Tokyo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edo

questions.question: What is Venezuela named after according to a popular theory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A city

questions.question: Situated very near Tokyo, this is the second largest city of Japan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yokohama

questions.question: What is the name of the capital and largest city of Venezuela?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caracas

questions.question: Why is it difficult to find ones way around Tokyo?

options.text: Only Japanese is allowed on direction signs and place names.
There are no accurate maps of Tokyo.
Most Japanese are rather rude to outsiders and dislike giving directions.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Only main streets have names.

questions.question: What form of governmental control has Venezuela established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Federal presidential republic

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about Tokyo during World War Two?

options.text: All important government agencies were in Tokyo and the Emperors retinue moved out of Tokyo to avoid possible bombing.
Tokyo was spared bombing because the US did not want to infuriate the Japanese people by bombing the city of their emperor.
Tokyo was captured by US forces who made an amphibious assault in the last month of the war.
Tokyo was heavily damaged by firebombing by the US Air Force.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tokyo was heavily damaged by firebombing by the US Air Force.

questions.question: Which of these famous women was born in Venezuela?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carolina Herrera

questions.question: Many people think of a motorcycle when they hear this name but it is also the name of a city of over a million people that is a next door suburb of Tokyo. Name the city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kawasaki
